item.title: Programming Languages Influence Network 2019 - Dark Background
item.description: A network graph showing 454 programming languages connected by 761 influence relations. Highly influential languages like Lisp, Smalltalk, C, Java, C++, Haskell and Python are shown as larger circles as compared to languages with less influence on others like PHP, Rust and Go. The influence relation data was retrieved from Wikidata December 30, 2019. A great gift for programmers who are into digital art.

item.title: Programming Languages Influence Network 2019 - Light Background
item.description: A network graph showing 454 programming languages connected by 761 influence relations. Highly influential languages like Lisp, Smalltalk, C, Java, C++, Haskell and Python are shown as larger circles as compared to languages with less influence on others like PHP, Rust and Go. The influence relation data was retrieved from Wikidata December 30, 2019. A great gift for programmers who are into digital art.

item.title: Rust Programming Language Influence Network
item.description: A network graph showing 24 programming languages connected by 47 influence relations. It includes languages the were influenced by Rust or influenced Rust and Rust itself. More influential languages are shown as larger circles as compared to languages with less influence on others. The influence relation data was retrieved from Wikidata in 2019. A great gift for programmers who are into digital art.

item.title: C Programming Language Influence Network
item.description: A network graph showing 64 programming languages connected by 122 influence relations. It includes languages the were influenced by C or influenced C and C itself. More influential languages are shown as larger circles as compared to languages with less influence on others. The influence relation data was retrieved from Wikidata in 2019. A great gift for programmers who are into digital art.

item.title: Programming Languages Influence Network 2018 - Light Background
item.description: A network graph showing 426 programming languages connected by 670 influence relations. Highly influential languages like Lisp, Smalltalk, C, Java, C++, Haskell and Python are shown as larger circles as compared to languages with less influence on others like PHP, Rust and Go. The influence relation data was retrieved from Wikidata in 2018. A great gift for programmers who are into digital art.

item.description: A network graph showing 426 programming languages connected by 670 influence relations. Highly influential languages like Lisp, Smalltalk, C, Java, C++, Haskell and Python are shown as larger circles as compared to languages with less influence on others like PHP, Rust and Go. The influence relation data was retrieved from Wikidata in 2018. A great gift for programmers who are into digital art.

item.title: Graph of Sister Cities With +1 Million Inhabitants - White Canvas
item.description: A network graph showing 279 cities with more than 1 million inhabitants and how they are connected to their sister cities within this set. The cities are the nodes which are sized by degree and colored by population and the 852 edges show the sister relation. The data for creating this graph was retrieved from Wikidata in April 2018.

item.title: Google Search based Knowledge Graph of Programmers
item.description: This graph shows the connections of programmers based on searches performed on Google in March 2013. The graph consists of 561 nodes and 1311 edges. To be included a person's search result page on Google needed to have knowledge graph information indicating the person being a programmer. The creators of the top programming languages according to GitHub served as seed values for searches, i. e. Brendan Eich (JavaScript), Yukihiro Matsumoto (Ruby), James Gosling (Java), Guido van Rossum (Python), Stephen R. Bourne (Bourne shell), William Nelson Joy (C shell), Rasmus Lerdorf (PHP), Dennis Ritchie (C), Bjarne Stroustrup (C++), Larry Wall (Perl), and Brad Cox (Objective-C). The graph print is available on posters and several other products on white or Rose Quartz backgrounds.

item.title: Network Graph of npm Top Packages Dependencies
item.description: A colorful graphic with a network graph showing the dependencies of npm packages with at least 10 inbound links, i. e. other packages that depend on them. The graph was calculated based on data from July 12, 2013 with 35,000 nodes and 66,551 edges.

item.title: Network Graph of npm Top Packages Dependencies
item.description: A colorful graphic with a network graph showing the dependencies of npm packages with at least 10 inbound links, i. e. other packages that depend on them. The graph was calculated based on data from July 12, 2013 and consists of 717 nodes and 942 edges.
